name: Server
description: Provides functionality to allow external (developer-controlled) servers to interact with user inventories and data in a trusted manner, and to handle matchmaking and client connection orchestration

properties.name: PlayFabId
properties.description: PlayFab unique identifier of the user whose virtual currency balance is to be incremented.

properties.name: VirtualCurrency
properties.description: Name of the virtual currency which is to be incremented.

properties.name: Amount
properties.description: Amount to be added to the user balance of the specified virtual currency.

properties.name: SharedGroupId
properties.description: Unique identifier for the shared group.

properties.name: PlayFabId
properties.description: PlayFab unique identifier of the user whose virtual currency balance is to be increased.

properties.name: VirtualCurrency
properties.description: Name of the virtual currency which is to be incremented.

properties.name: Amount
properties.description: Amount to be added to the user balance of the specified virtual currency.

properties.name: SessionTicket
properties.description: Session ticket as issued by a PlayFab client login API.

properties.name: UserInfo
properties.description: Account info for the user whose session ticket was supplied.

properties.name: AchievementName
properties.description: Unique Steam achievement name.

properties.name: Result
properties.description: Result of the award attempt (only valid on response, not on request).

properties.name: Achievements
properties.description: Array of achievements to grant and the users to whom they are to be granted.

properties.name: AchievementResults
properties.description: Array of achievements granted.

CatalogItem.name: CatalogItem
CatalogItem.description: A purchasable item from the item catalog

properties.name: ItemId
properties.description: unique identifier for this item

properties.name: ItemClass
properties.description: class to which the item belongs

properties.name: CatalogVersion
properties.description: catalog item for this item

properties.name: DisplayName
properties.description: text name for the item, to show in-game

properties.name: Description
properties.description: text description of item, to show in-game

properties.name: VirtualCurrencyPrices
properties.description: price of this item in virtual currencies and "RM" (the base Real Money purchase price, in USD pennies)

properties.name: RealCurrencyPrices
properties.description: override prices for this item for specific currencies

properties.name: Tags
properties.description: list of item tags

properties.name: CustomData
properties.description: game specific custom data

properties.name: GrantedIfPlayerHas
properties.description: array of ItemId values which are evaluated when any item is added to the player inventory - if all items in this array are present, the this item will also be added to the player inventory

properties.name: Consumable
properties.description: defines the consumable properties (number of uses, timeout) for the item

properties.name: Container
properties.description: defines the container properties for the item - what items it contains, including random drop tables and virtual currencies, and what item (if any) is required to open it via the UnlockContainerItem API

properties.name: Bundle
properties.description: defines the bundle properties for the item - bundles are items which contain other items, including random drop tables and virtual currencies

properties.name: CanBecomeCharacter
properties.description: if true, then this item instance can be used to grant a character to a user.

properties.name: IsStackable
properties.description: if true, then only one item instance of this type will exist and its remaininguses will be incremented instead

properties.name: BundledItems
properties.description: unique ItemId values for all items which will be added to the player inventory when the bundle is added

properties.name: BundledResultTables
properties.description: unique TableId values for all RandomResultTable objects which are part of the bundle (random tables will be resolved and add the relevant items to the player inventory when the bundle is added)

properties.name: BundledVirtualCurrencies
properties.description: virtual currency types and balances which will be added to the player inventory when the bundle is added

properties.name: UsageCount
properties.description: number of times this object can be used, after which it will be removed from the player inventory

properties.name: UsagePeriod
properties.description: duration in seconds for how long the item will remain in the player inventory - once elapsed, the item will be removed

properties.name: UsagePeriodGroup
properties.description: all inventory item instances in the player inventory sharing a non-null UsagePeriodGroup have their UsagePeriod values added together, and share the result - when that period has elapsed, all the items in the group will be removed

CatalogItemContainerInfo.name: CatalogItemContainerInfo
CatalogItemContainerInfo.description: Containers are inventory items that can hold other items defined in the catalog, as well as virtual currency, which is added to the player inventory when the container is unlocked, using the UnlockContainerItem API. The items can be anything defined in the catalog, as well as RandomResultTable objects which will be resolved when the container is unlocked. Containers and their keys should be defined as Consumable (having a limited number of uses) in their catalog defintiions, unless the intent is for the player to be able to re-use them infinitely.

properties.name: KeyItemId
properties.description: ItemId for the catalog item used to unlock the container, if any (if not specified, a call to UnlockContainerItem will open the container, adding the contents to the player inventory and currency balances)

properties.name: ItemContents
properties.description: unique ItemId values for all items which will be added to the player inventory, once the container has been unlocked

properties.name: ResultTableContents
properties.description: unique TableId values for all RandomResultTable objects which are part of the container (once unlocked, random tables will be resolved and add the relevant items to the player inventory)

properties.name: VirtualCurrencyContents
properties.description: virtual currency types and balances which will be added to the player inventory when the container is unlocked

properties.name: PlayFabId
properties.description: PlayFab unique identifier of the user for this leaderboard entry.

properties.name: CharacterId
properties.description: PlayFab unique identifier of the character that belongs to the user for this leaderboard entry.

properties.name: CharacterName
properties.description: Title-specific display name of the character for this leaderboard entry.

properties.name: DisplayName
properties.description: Title-specific display name of the user for this leaderboard entry.

properties.name: CharacterType
properties.description: Name of the character class for this entry.

properties.name: StatValue
properties.description: Specific value of the user's statistic.

properties.name: Position
properties.description: User's overall position in the leaderboard.

properties.name: SharedGroupId
properties.description: Unique identifier for the shared group (a random identifier will be assigned, if one is not specified).

properties.name: SharedGroupId
properties.description: Unique identifier for the shared group.

properties.name: SaveCharacterInventory
properties.description: If true, the character's inventory will be transferred up to the owning user; otherwise, this request will purge those items.

properties.name: SharedGroupId
properties.description: Unique identifier for the shared group.

properties.name: CatalogVersion
properties.description: Which catalog is being requested.

properties.name: Catalog
properties.description: Array of items which can be purchased.

properties.name: Keys
properties.description: Specific keys to search for in the custom user data.

properties.name: Data
properties.description: Character specific data for this title.

properties.name: CatalogVersion
properties.description: Used to limit results to only those from a specific catalog version.

properties.name: Inventory
properties.description: Array of inventory items belonging to the character.

properties.name: VirtualCurrency
properties.description: Array of virtual currency balance(s) belonging to the character.

properties.name: CharacterType
properties.description: Optional character type on which to filter the leaderboard entries.

properties.name: StatisticName
properties.description: Unique identifier for the title-specific statistic for the leaderboard.

properties.name: StartPosition
properties.description: First entry in the leaderboard to be retrieved.

properties.name: MaxResultsCount
properties.description: Maximum number of entries to retrieve.

properties.name: Leaderboard
properties.description: Ordered list of leaderboard entries.

properties.name: CharacterStatistics
properties.description: Character statistics for the requested user.

properties.name: Key
properties.description: Key of the content item to fetch, usually formatted as a path, e.g. images/a.png

properties.name: HttpMethod
properties.description: HTTP method to fetch item - GET or HEAD. Use HEAD when only fetching metadata. Default is GET.

properties.name: ThruCDN
properties.description: True if download through CDN. CDN provides better download bandwidth and time. However, if you want latest, non-cached version of the content, set this to false. Default is true.

properties.name: URL
properties.description: URL for downloading content via HTTP GET or HEAD method. The URL will expire in 1 hour.

properties.name: StatisticName
properties.description: Unique identifier for the title-specific statistic for the leaderboard.

properties.name: CharacterType
properties.description: Optional character type on which to filter the leaderboard entries.

properties.name: MaxResultsCount
properties.description: Maximum number of entries to retrieve.

properties.name: Leaderboard
properties.description: Ordered list of leaderboard entries.

properties.name: StatisticName
properties.description: Unique identifier for the title-specific statistic for the leaderboard.

properties.name: MaxResultsCount
properties.description: Maximum number of entries to retrieve.

properties.name: Leaderboard
properties.description: Ordered list of leaderboard entries.

properties.name: StatisticName
properties.description: Unique identifier for the title-specific statistic for the leaderboard.

properties.name: MaxResultsCount
properties.description: Maximum number of entries to retrieve.

properties.name: Leaderboard
properties.description: Ordered list of leaderboard entries.

properties.name: StatisticName
properties.description: Unique identifier for the title-specific statistic for the leaderboard.

properties.name: StartPosition
properties.description: First entry in the leaderboard to be retrieved.

properties.name: MaxResultsCount
properties.description: Maximum number of entries to retrieve.

properties.name: Leaderboard
properties.description: Ordered list of leaderboard entries.

properties.name: Keys
properties.description: array of keys to get back data from the Publisher data blob, set by the admin tools

properties.name: Data
properties.description: a dictionary object of key / value pairs

properties.name: SharedGroupId
properties.description: Unique identifier for the shared group.

properties.name: Keys
properties.description: Specific keys to retrieve from the shared group (if not specified, all keys will be returned, while an empty array indicates that no keys should be returned).

properties.name: GetMembers
properties.description: If true, return the list of all members of the shared group.

properties.name: Data
properties.description: Data for the requested keys.

properties.name: Members
properties.description: List of PlayFabId identifiers for the members of this group, if requested.

properties.name: Keys
properties.description: array of keys to get back data from the TitleData data blob, set by the admin tools

properties.name: Data
properties.description: a dictionary object of key / value pairs

properties.name: UserInfo
properties.description: Account info for the user whose information was requested.

properties.name: Keys
properties.description: Specific keys to search for in the custom user data.

properties.name: PlayFabId
properties.description: PlayFab unique identifier of the user whose custom data is being returned.

properties.name: Data
properties.description: User specific data for this title.

properties.name: CatalogVersion
properties.description: Used to limit results to only those from a specific catalog version.

properties.name: Inventory
properties.description: Array of inventory items belonging to the user.

properties.name: VirtualCurrency
properties.description: Array of virtual currency balance(s) belonging to the user.

properties.name: VirtualCurrencyRechargeTimes
properties.description: Array of remaining times and timestamps for virtual currencies.

properties.name: PlayFabId
properties.description: User for whom statistics are being requested.

properties.name: UserStatistics
properties.description: User statistics for the requested user.

properties.name: CharacterName
properties.description: Non-unique display name of the character being granted.

properties.name: CharacterType
properties.description: Type of the character being granted; statistics can be sliced based on this value.

properties.name: CharacterId
properties.description: Unique identifier tagged to this character.

properties.name: CatalogVersion
properties.description: Catalog version from which items are to be granted.

properties.name: Annotation
properties.description: String detailing any additional information concerning this operation.

properties.name: ItemIds
properties.description: Array of itemIds to grant to the user.

properties.name: ItemGrantResults
properties.description: Array of items granted to users.

properties.name: CatalogVersion
properties.description: Catalog version from which items are to be granted.

properties.name: Annotation
properties.description: String detailing any additional information concerning this operation.

properties.name: ItemIds
properties.description: Array of itemIds to grant to the user.

properties.name: ItemGrantResults
properties.description: Array of items granted to users.

properties.name: CatalogVersion
properties.description: Catalog version from which items are to be granted.

properties.name: ItemGrants
properties.description: Array of items to grant and the users to whom the items are to be granted.

properties.name: ItemGrantResults
properties.description: Array of items granted to users.

properties.name: ItemId
properties.description: Unique identifier of the catalog item to be granted to the user.

properties.name: Annotation
properties.description: String detailing any additional information concerning this operation.

ItemGrantResult.name: ItemGrantResult
ItemGrantResult.description: Result of granting an item to a user

properties.name: ItemId
properties.description: Unique identifier of the catalog item to be granted to the user.

properties.name: ItemInstanceId
properties.description: Unique instance Id of the granted item.

properties.name: Annotation
properties.description: String detailing any additional information concerning this operation.

properties.name: Result
properties.description: Result of this operation.

ItemInstance.name: ItemInstance
ItemInstance.description: A unique instance of an item in a user's inventory

properties.name: ItemId
properties.description: Unique identifier for the inventory item, as defined in the catalog.

properties.name: ItemInstanceId
properties.description: Unique item identifier for this specific instance of the item.

properties.name: ItemClass
properties.description: Class name for the inventory item, as defined in the catalog.

properties.name: PurchaseDate
properties.description: Timestamp for when this instance was purchased.

properties.name: Expiration
properties.description: Timestamp for when this instance will expire.

properties.name: RemainingUses
properties.description: Total number of remaining uses, if this is a consumable item.

properties.name: Annotation
properties.description: Game specific comment associated with this instance when it was added to the user inventory.

properties.name: CatalogVersion
properties.description: Catalog version for the inventory item, when this instance was created.

properties.name: BundleParent
properties.description: Unique identifier for the parent inventory item, as defined in the catalog, for object which were added from a bundle or container.

properties.name: CustomData
properties.description: A set of custom key-value pairs on the inventory item.

properties.name: PlayFabId
properties.description: PlayFab User Id of the player associated with this event. For non-player associated events, this must be null and EntityId must be set.

properties.name: EntityId
properties.description: For non player-associated events, a unique ID for the entity associated with this event. For player associated events, this must be null and PlayFabId must be set.

properties.name: EntityType
properties.description: For non player-associated events, the type of entity associated with this event. For player associated events, this must be null.

properties.name: Timestamp
properties.description: Optional timestamp for this event. If null, the a timestamp is auto-assigned to the event on the server.

properties.name: EventName
properties.description: A unique event name which will be used as the table name in the Redshift database. The name will be made lower case, and cannot not contain spaces. The use of underscores is recommended, for readability. Events also cannot match reserved terms. The PlayFab reserved terms are 'log_in' and 'purchase', 'create' and 'request', while the Redshift reserved terms can be found here: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/r_pg_keywords.html.

properties.name: Body
properties.description: Contains all the data for this event. Event Values can be strings, booleans or numerics (float, double, integer, long) and must be consistent on a per-event basis (if the Value for Key 'A' in Event 'Foo' is an integer the first time it is sent, it must be an integer in all subsequent 'Foo' events). As with event names, Keys must also not use reserved words (see above). Finally, the size of the Body for an event must be less than 32KB (UTF-8 format).

properties.name: ProfileSetEvent
properties.description: Flag to set event Body as profile details in the Redshift database as well as a standard event.

properties.name: VirtualCurrency
properties.description: Name of the virtual currency which was modified.

properties.name: Balance
properties.description: Balance of the virtual currency after modification.

properties.name: PlayFabId
properties.description: PlayFab unique identifier of the user whose item is being modified.

properties.name: ItemInstanceId
properties.description: Unique instance identifier of the item to be modified.

properties.name: UsesToAdd
properties.description: Number of uses to add to the item. Can be negative to remove uses.

properties.name: ItemInstanceId
properties.description: Unique instance identifier of the item with uses consumed.

properties.name: RemainingUses
properties.description: Number of uses remaining on the item.

properties.name: PlayFabId
properties.description: User currency was subtracted from.

properties.name: VirtualCurrency
properties.description: Name of the virtual currency which was modified.

properties.name: BalanceChange
properties.description: Amount added or subtracted from the user's virtual currency.

properties.name: Balance
properties.description: Balance of the virtual currency after modification.

properties.name: GivingCharacterId
properties.description: Unique identifier of the character that currently has the item.

properties.name: ReceivingCharacterId
properties.description: Unique identifier of the character that will be receiving the item.

properties.name: LobbyId
properties.description: Unique identifier of the Game Instance the user is leaving.

properties.name: PlayerState
properties.description: State of user leaving the Game Server Instance.

properties.name: PlayFabId
properties.description: PlayFab unique identifier of the user for this leaderboard entry.

properties.name: DisplayName
properties.description: Title-specific display name of the user for this leaderboard entry.

properties.name: StatValue
properties.description: Specific value of the user's statistic.

properties.name: Position
properties.description: User's overall position in the leaderboard.

properties.name: Ticket
properties.description: Server authorization ticket passed back from a call to Matchmake or StartGame.

properties.name: LobbyId
properties.description: Unique identifier of the Game Server Instance that is asking for validation of the authorization ticket.

properties.name: TicketIsValid
properties.description: Boolean indicating whether the ticket was validated by the PlayFab service.

properties.name: Error
properties.description: Error value if the ticket was not validated.

properties.name: UserInfo
properties.description: User account information for the user validated.

properties.name: SharedGroupId
properties.description: Unique identifier for the shared group.

properties.name: ReporterId
properties.description: PlayFabId of the reporting player.

properties.name: ReporteeId
properties.description: PlayFabId of the reported player.

properties.name: TitleId
properties.description: Title player was reported in, optional if report not for specific title.

properties.name: Comment
properties.description: Optional additional comment by reporting player.

properties.name: Recipient
properties.description: PlayFabId of the recipient of the push notification.

properties.name: Message
properties.description: Text of message to send.

properties.name: Subject
properties.description: Subject of message to send (may not be displayed in all platforms.

properties.name: Key
properties.description: key we want to set a value on (note, this is additive - will only replace an existing key's value if they are the same name.) Keys are trimmed of whitespace. Keys may not begin with the '!' character.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: new value to set. Set to null to remove a value

properties.name: Key
properties.description: key we want to set a value on (note, this is additive - will only replace an existing key's value if they are the same name.) Keys are trimmed of whitespace. Keys may not begin with the '!' character.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: new value to set. Set to null to remove a value

properties.name: Value
properties.description: Data stored for the specified group data key.

properties.name: LastUpdatedBy
properties.description: PlayFabId of the user to last update this value.

properties.name: LastUpdated
properties.description: Timestamp for when this data was last updated.

properties.name: Permission
properties.description: Indicates whether this data can be read by all users (public) or only members of the group (private).

properties.name: VirtualCurrency
properties.description: Name of the virtual currency which is to be decremented.

properties.name: Amount
properties.description: Amount to be subtracted from the user balance of the specified virtual currency.

properties.name: PlayFabId
properties.description: PlayFab unique identifier of the user whose virtual currency balance is to be decreased.

properties.name: VirtualCurrency
properties.description: Name of the virtual currency which is to be decremented.

properties.name: Amount
properties.description: Amount to be subtracted from the user balance of the specified virtual currency.

properties.name: Data
properties.description: Data to be written to the user's character's custom data. Note that keys are trimmed of whitespace, are limited to 1024 characters, and may not begin with a '!' character.

properties.name: Permission
properties.description: Permission to be applied to all user data keys written in this request. Defaults to "private" if not set.

properties.name: CharacterStatistics
properties.description: Statistics to be updated with the provided values.

properties.name: SharedGroupId
properties.description: Unique identifier for the shared group.

properties.name: Data
properties.description: Key value pairs to be stored in the shared group - note that keys will be trimmed of whitespace, must not begin with a '!' character, and that null values will result in the removal of the key from the data set.

properties.name: Permission
properties.description: Permission to be applied to all user data keys in this request.

properties.name: Data
properties.description: Data to be written to the user's custom data. Note that keys are trimmed of whitespace, are limited to 1024 characters, and may not begin with a '!' character.

properties.name: Permission
properties.description: Permission to be applied to all user data keys written in this request. Defaults to "private" if not set.

properties.name: Data
properties.description: Data to be written to the user's custom data.

properties.name: Data
properties.description: Data to be written to the item's custom data. Note that keys are trimmed of whitespace.

properties.name: UserStatistics
properties.description: Statistics to be updated with the provided values.

properties.name: PlayFabId
properties.description: unique identifier for the user account

properties.name: Created
properties.description: timestamp indicating when the user account was created

properties.name: Username
properties.description: user account name in the PlayFab service

properties.name: TitleInfo
properties.description: title-specific information for the user account

properties.name: PrivateInfo
properties.description: personal information for the user which is considered more sensitive

properties.name: FacebookInfo
properties.description: user Facebook information, if a Facebook account has been linked

properties.name: SteamInfo
properties.description: user Steam information, if a Steam account has been linked

properties.name: GameCenterInfo
properties.description: user Gamecenter information, if a Gamecenter account has been linked

properties.name: Value
properties.description: User-supplied data for this user data key.

properties.name: LastUpdated
properties.description: Timestamp indicating when this data was last updated.

properties.name: Permission
properties.description: Permissions on this data key.

properties.name: FacebookId
properties.description: Facebook identifier

properties.name: FullName
properties.description: Facebook full name

properties.name: GameCenterId
properties.description: Gamecenter identifier

properties.name: Email
properties.description: user email address

properties.name: SteamId
properties.description: Steam identifier

properties.name: SteamCountry
properties.description: the country in which the player resides, from Steam data

properties.name: SteamCurrency
properties.description: currency type set in the user Steam account

properties.name: SteamActivationStatus
properties.description: what stage of game ownership the user is listed as being in, from Steam

properties.name: DisplayName
properties.description: name of the user, as it is displayed in-game

properties.name: Origination
properties.description: source by which the user first joined the game, if known

properties.name: Created
properties.description: timestamp indicating when the user was first associated with this game (this can differ significantly from when the user first registered with PlayFab)

properties.name: LastLogin
properties.description: timestamp for the last user login for this title

properties.name: FirstLogin
properties.description: timestamp indicating when the user first signed into this game (this can differ from the Created timestamp, as other events, such as issuing a beta key to the user, can associate the title to the user)

properties.name: isBanned
properties.description: boolean indicating whether or not the user is currently banned for a title

properties.name: SecondsToRecharge
properties.description: Time remaining (in seconds) before the next recharge increment of the virtual currency.

properties.name: RechargeTime
properties.description: Server timestamp in UTC indicating the next time the virtual currency will be incremented.

properties.name: RechargeMax
properties.description: Maximum value to which the regenerating currency will automatically increment. Note that it can exceed this value through use of the AddUserVirtualCurrency API call. However, it will not regenerate automatically until it has fallen below this value.

calls.name: AuthenticateSessionTicket
calls.summary: Validated a client's session ticket, and if successful, returns details for that user
calls.requestDetails: Note that data returned may be Personally Identifying Information (PII), such as email address, and so care should be taken in how this data is stored and managed. Since this call will always return the relevant information for users who have accessed the title, the recommendation is to not store this data locally.

calls.name: GetUserAccountInfo
calls.summary: Retrieves the relevant details for a specified user
calls.requestDetails: This API allows for access to details regarding a user in the PlayFab service, usually for purposes of customer support. Note that data returned may be Personally Identifying Information (PII), such as email address, and so care should be taken in how this data is stored and managed. Since this call will always return the relevant information for users who have accessed the title, the recommendation is to not store this data locally.

calls.name: SendPushNotification
calls.summary: Sends an iOS/Android Push Notification to a specific user, if that user's device has been configured for Push Notifications in PlayFab. If a user has linked both Android and iOS devices, both will be notified.

calls.name: GetLeaderboard
calls.summary: Retrieves a list of ranked users for the given statistic, starting from the indicated point in the leaderboard
calls.resultDetails: Note that the Position of the user in the results is for the overall leaderboard.

calls.name: GetLeaderboardAroundUser
calls.summary: Retrieves a list of ranked users for the given statistic, centered on the currently signed-in user
calls.resultDetails: Note that the Position of the user in the results is for the overall leaderboard.

calls.name: GetUserData
calls.summary: Retrieves the title-specific custom data for the user which is readable and writable by the client
calls.requestDetails: Data is stored as JSON key-value pairs. If the Keys parameter is provided, the data object returned will only contain the data specific to the indicated Keys. Otherwise, the full set of custom user data will be returned.

calls.name: GetUserInternalData
calls.summary: Retrieves the title-specific custom data for the user which cannot be accessed by the client
calls.requestDetails: Data is stored as JSON key-value pairs. If the Keys parameter is provided, the data object returned will only contain the data specific to the indicated Keys. Otherwise, the full set of custom user data will be returned.

calls.name: GetUserPublisherData
calls.summary: Retrieves the publisher-specific custom data for the user which is readable and writable by the client
calls.requestDetails: Data is stored as JSON key-value pairs. If the Keys parameter is provided, the data object returned will only contain the data specific to the indicated Keys. Otherwise, the full set of custom user data will be returned.

calls.name: GetUserPublisherInternalData
calls.summary: Retrieves the publisher-specific custom data for the user which cannot be accessed by the client
calls.requestDetails: Data is stored as JSON key-value pairs. If the Keys parameter is provided, the data object returned will only contain the data specific to the indicated Keys. Otherwise, the full set of custom user data will be returned.

calls.name: GetUserPublisherReadOnlyData
calls.summary: Retrieves the publisher-specific custom data for the user which can only be read by the client
calls.requestDetails: Data is stored as JSON key-value pairs. If the Keys parameter is provided, the data object returned will only contain the data specific to the indicated Keys. Otherwise, the full set of custom user data will be returned.

calls.name: GetUserReadOnlyData
calls.summary: Retrieves the title-specific custom data for the user which can only be read by the client
calls.requestDetails: Data is stored as JSON key-value pairs. If the Keys parameter is provided, the data object returned will only contain the data specific to the indicated Keys. Otherwise, the full set of custom user data will be returned.

calls.name: GetUserStatistics
calls.summary: Retrieves the details of all title-specific statistics for the user
calls.resultDetails: User statistics are numeric values which may only be updated by a  server operation, in order to minimize the opportunity for unauthorized changes. In addition to  being available for use by the title, the statistics are used for all leaderboard operations in PlayFab.

calls.name: UpdateUserData
calls.summary: Updates the title-specific custom data for the user which is readable and writable by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, while keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: UpdateUserInternalData
calls.summary: Updates the title-specific custom data for the user which cannot be accessed by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: UpdateUserPublisherData
calls.summary: Updates the publisher-specific custom data for the user which is readable and writable by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, while keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: UpdateUserPublisherInternalData
calls.summary: Updates the publisher-specific custom data for the user which cannot be accessed by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: UpdateUserPublisherReadOnlyData
calls.summary: Updates the publisher-specific custom data for the user which can only be read by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: UpdateUserReadOnlyData
calls.summary: Updates the title-specific custom data for the user which can only be read by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: UpdateUserStatistics
calls.summary: Updates the values of the specified title-specific statistics for the user
calls.requestDetails: This operation is additive. Statistics not currently defined will be added, while those already defined will be updated with the given values. All other user statistics will remain unchanged.
calls.resultDetails: User statistics are numeric values which may only be updated by a server operation, in order to minimize the opportunity for unauthorized changes. In addition to being available for use by the title, the statistics are used for all leaderboard operations in PlayFab.

calls.name: GetCatalogItems
calls.summary: Retrieves the specified version of the title's catalog of virtual goods, including all defined properties

calls.name: GetTitleData
calls.summary: Retrieves the key-value store of custom title settings
calls.requestDetails: This API is designed to return title specific values which can be read, but not written to, by the client. For example, a developer could choose to store values which modify the user experience, such as enemy spawn rates, weapon strengths, movement speeds, etc. This allows a developer to update the title without the need to create, test, and ship a new build.

calls.name: GetTitleInternalData
calls.summary: Retrieves the key-value store of custom internal title settings
calls.requestDetails: This API is designed to return title specific values which are accessible only to the server. This can be used to tweak settings on game servers and Cloud Scripts without needed to update and re-deploy them.

calls.name: SetTitleData
calls.summary: Updates the key-value store of custom title settings
calls.requestDetails: This API is designed to store title specific values which can be read, but not written to, by the client. For example, a developer could choose to store values which modify the user experience, such as enemy spawn rates, weapon strengths, movement speeds, etc. This allows a developer to update the title without the need to create, test, and ship a new build. This operation is additive. If a Key does not exist in the current dataset, it will be added with the specified Value. If it already exists, the Value for that key will be overwritten with the new Value.

calls.name: SetTitleInternalData
calls.summary: Updates the key-value store of custom title settings
calls.requestDetails: This API is designed to store title specific values which are accessible only to the server. This can be used to tweak settings on game servers and Cloud Scripts without needed to update and re-deploy them.. This operation is additive. If a Key does not exist in the current dataset, it will be added with the specified Value. If it already exists, the Value for that key will be overwritten with the new Value.

calls.name: AddCharacterVirtualCurrency
calls.summary: Increments  the character's balance of the specified virtual currency by the stated amount

calls.name: AddUserVirtualCurrency
calls.summary: Increments  the user's balance of the specified virtual currency by the stated amount

calls.name: GetCharacterInventory
calls.summary: Retrieves the specified character's current inventory of virtual goods
calls.requestDetails: All items currently in the character inventory will be returned, irrespective of how they were acquired (via purchasing, grants, coupons, etc.). Items that are expired, fully consumed, or are no longer valid are not considered to be in the user's current inventory, and so will not be not included. Also returns their virtual currency balances.

calls.name: GetUserInventory
calls.summary: Retrieves the specified user's current inventory of virtual goods
calls.requestDetails: All items currently in the user inventory will be returned, irrespective of how they were acquired (via purchasing, grants, coupons, etc.). Items that are expired, fully consumed, or are no longer valid are not considered to be in the user's current inventory, and so will not be not included.

calls.name: GrantItemsToCharacter
calls.summary: Adds the specified items to the specified character's inventory
calls.requestDetails: This function directly adds inventory items to the character's inventories. As  a result of this operations, the user will not be charged any transaction fee, regardless of the inventory item  catalog definition.

calls.name: GrantItemsToUser
calls.summary: Adds the specified items to the specified user's inventory
calls.requestDetails: This function directly adds inventory items to the user's inventories. As a result of this operations, the user will not be charged any transaction fee, regardless of the inventory item catalog definition.

calls.name: GrantItemsToUsers
calls.summary: Adds the specified items to the specified user inventories
calls.requestDetails: This function directly adds inventory items to user inventories. As a result of this operations, the user will not be charged any transaction fee, regardless of the inventory item catalog definition.

calls.name: ModifyItemUses
calls.summary: Modifies the number of remaining uses of a player's inventory item
calls.requestDetails: This function can both add and remove uses of an inventory item. If the number of uses drops below zero, the item will be removed from active inventory.

calls.name: MoveItemToCharacterFromCharacter
calls.summary: Moves an item from a character's inventory into another of the users's character's inventory.
calls.requestDetails: Transfers an item from a character to another character that is owned by the same user. This will remove the item from the character's inventory (until and unless it is moved back), and will enable the other character to make use of the item instead.

calls.name: MoveItemToCharacterFromUser
calls.summary: Moves an item from a user's inventory into their character's inventory.
calls.requestDetails: Transfers an item from a user to a character she owns. This will remove the item from the user's inventory (until and unless it is moved back), and will enable the character to make use of the item instead.

calls.name: MoveItemToUserFromCharacter
calls.summary: Moves an item from a character's inventory into the owning user's inventory.
calls.requestDetails: Transfers an item from a character to the owning user. This will remove the item from the character's inventory (until and unless it is moved back), and will enable the user to make use of the item instead.

calls.name: ReportPlayer
calls.summary: Submit a report about a player (due to bad bahavior, etc.) on behalf of another player, so that customer service representatives for the title can take action concerning potentially poxic players.
calls.resultDetails: Players are currently limited to five reports per day. Attempts by a single user account to submit reports beyond five will result in Updated being returned as false.

calls.name: SubtractCharacterVirtualCurrency
calls.summary: Decrements the character's balance of the specified virtual currency by the stated amount

calls.name: SubtractUserVirtualCurrency
calls.summary: Decrements the user's balance of the specified virtual currency by the stated amount

calls.name: UpdateUserInventoryItemCustomData
calls.summary: Updates the key-value pair data tagged to the specified item, which is read-only from the client.
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the item instance which belongs to the specified user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, while  keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: NotifyMatchmakerPlayerLeft
calls.summary: Informs the PlayFab match-making service that the user specified has left the Game Server Instance

calls.name: RedeemMatchmakerTicket
calls.summary: Validates a Game Server session ticket and returns details about the user
calls.requestDetails: This function is used by a Game Server Instance to validate with the PlayFab service that a user has been registered as connected to the server. The Ticket is provided to the client either as a result of a call to StartGame or Matchmake, each of which return a Ticket specific to the Game Server Instance. This function will fail in any case where the Ticket presented is not valid for the specific Game Server Instance making the call. Note that data returned may be Personally Identifying Information (PII), such as email address, and so care should be taken in how this data is stored and managed. Since this call will always return the relevant information for users who have accessed the title, the recommendation is to not store this data locally.

calls.name: AwardSteamAchievement
calls.summary: Awards the specified users the specified Steam achievements

calls.name: LogEvent
calls.summary: Logs a custom analytics event
calls.requestDetails: This API is designed to track analytics events. Events logged using this API will be stored in the title's Redshift database. Each unique eventName will create a distinct table within the database. Within that table, a column will be created for every unique key. Using a first-person shooter as an example, the title may need to track headshots as a distinct event. The sample request below demonstrates an example of this. In addition to the values sent, timestamps and User IDs are automatically added as 'ts' and 'user_id' to each table. The 'Headshot' table in this example would then have the schema: 'user_id'|'ts'|'victim'|'gun'|'x_coord'|'y_coord'|'z_coord'|'damage|aim_assist' and the row corresponding to this event would look like: 'EF987654ABAB012'|'2014-1-1 12:12:12'|'B76543AEAE65'|'big_bad_sniper'|10|20|1|1000|1.The PlayFab service automatically creates events for all login and purchase operations. This API is intended for game specific events only. Please note that event logging is not enabled for titles by default. If you need event logging enabled, please contact us at devrel@playfab.com for more information.

calls.name: AddSharedGroupMembers
calls.summary: Adds users to the set of those able to update both the shared data, as well as the set of users in the group. Only users in the group (and the server) can add new members.

calls.name: CreateSharedGroup
calls.summary: Requests the creation of a shared group object, containing key/value pairs which may be updated by all members of the group. When created by a server, the group will initially have no members.
calls.requestDetails: If SharedGroupId is specified, the service will attempt to create a group with that identifier, and will return an error if it is already in use. If no SharedGroupId is specified, a random identifier will be assigned.

calls.name: DeleteSharedGroup
calls.summary: Deletes a shared group, freeing up the shared group ID to be reused for a new group

calls.name: GetPublisherData
calls.summary: Retrieves the key-value store of custom publisher settings
calls.requestDetails: This API is designed to return publisher-specific values which can be read, but not written to, by the client. This data is shared across all titles assigned to a particular publisher, and can be used for cross-game coordination. Only titles assigned to a publisher can use this API. For more information email devrel@playfab.com

calls.name: GetSharedGroupData
calls.summary: Retrieves data stored in a shared group object, as well as the list of members in the group. The server can access all public and private group data.

calls.name: RemoveSharedGroupMembers
calls.summary: Removes users from the set of those able to update the shared data and the set of users in the group. Only users in the group can remove members. If as a result of the call, zero users remain with access, the group and its associated data will be deleted.

calls.name: SetPublisherData
calls.summary: Updates the key-value store of custom publisher settings
calls.requestDetails: This API is designed to store publisher-specific values which can be read, but not written to, by the client. This data is shared across all titles assigned to a particular publisher, and can be used for cross-game coordination. Only titles assigned to a publisher can use this API. This operation is additive.  If a Key does not exist in the current dataset, it will be added with the specified Value. If it already exists, the Value for that key will be overwritten with the new Value. For more information email devrel@playfab.com

calls.name: UpdateSharedGroupData
calls.summary: Adds, updates, and removes data keys for a shared group object. If the permission is set to Public, all fields updated or added in this call will be readable by users not in the group. By default, data permissions are set to Private. Regardless of the permission setting, only members of the group (and the server) can update the data.
calls.requestDetails: Note that in the case of multiple calls to write to the same shared group data keys, the last write received by the PlayFab service will determine the value available to subsequent read operations. For scenarios requiring coordination of data updates, it is recommended that titles make use of user data with read permission set to public, or a combination of user data and shared group data.

calls.name: GetContentDownloadUrl
calls.summary: Retrieves the pre-authorized URL for accessing a content file for the title. A subsequent HTTP GET to the returned URL downloads the content; or a HEAD query to the returned URL retrieves the metadata of the content. This API only generates a pre-signed URL to access the content. A success result does not guarantee the existence of the content.

calls.name: DeleteCharacterFromUser
calls.summary: Deletes the specific character ID from the specified user.
calls.requestDetails: This function will delete the specified character from the list allowed by the user, and  will also delete any inventory or VC currently held by that character. It will NOT delete any statistics  associated for this character, in order to preserve leaderboard integrity.

calls.name: GetAllUsersCharacters
calls.summary: Lists all of the characters that belong to a specific user.
calls.requestDetails: Returns a list of every character that currently belongs to a user.

calls.name: GetCharacterLeaderboard
calls.summary: Retrieves a list of ranked characters for the given statistic, starting from the indicated point in the leaderboard
calls.resultDetails: Note that the Position of the character in the results is for the overall leaderboard.

calls.name: GetCharacterStatistics
calls.summary: Retrieves the details of all title-specific statistics for the specific character
calls.requestDetails: Character statistics are similar to user statistics in that they are numeric values which  may only be updated by a server operation, in order to minimize the opportunity for unauthorized changes. In addition to  being available for use by the title, the statistics are used for all leaderboard operations in PlayFab.

calls.name: GetLeaderboardAroundCharacter
calls.summary: Retrieves a list of ranked characters for the given statistic, centered on the requested user
calls.resultDetails: Note that the Position of the user in the results is for the overall leaderboard.

calls.name: GetLeaderboardForUserCharacters
calls.summary: Retrieves a list of all of the user's characters for the given statistic.
calls.resultDetails: Note that the Position of the user in the results is for the overall leaderboard.

calls.name: GrantCharacterToUser
calls.summary: Grants the specified character type to the user.
calls.requestDetails: Grants a character to the user of the type and name specified in the request.

calls.name: UpdateCharacterStatistics
calls.summary: Updates the values of the specified title-specific statistics for the specific character
calls.requestDetails: Character statistics are similar to user statistics in that they are numeric values which  may only be updated by a server operation, in order to minimize the opportunity for unauthorized changes. In addition to  being available for use by the title, the statistics are used for all leaderboard operations in PlayFab.

calls.name: GetCharacterData
calls.summary: Retrieves the title-specific custom data for the user which is readable and writable by the client
calls.requestDetails: Data is stored as JSON key-value pairs. If the Keys parameter is provided, the data object returned will only contain the data specific to the indicated Keys. Otherwise, the full set of custom user data will be returned.

calls.name: GetCharacterInternalData
calls.summary: Retrieves the title-specific custom data for the user's character which cannot be accessed by the client
calls.requestDetails: Data is stored as JSON key-value pairs. If the Keys parameter is provided, the data object returned will only contain the data specific to the indicated Keys. Otherwise, the full set of custom user data will be returned.

calls.name: GetCharacterReadOnlyData
calls.summary: Retrieves the title-specific custom data for the user's character which can only be read by the client
calls.requestDetails: Data is stored as JSON key-value pairs. If the Keys parameter is provided, the data object returned will only contain the data specific to the indicated Keys. Otherwise, the full set of custom data will be returned.

calls.name: UpdateCharacterData
calls.summary: Updates the title-specific custom data for the user's chjaracter which is readable and writable by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, while keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart  from those specified in the call.

calls.name: UpdateCharacterInternalData
calls.summary: Updates the title-specific custom data for the user's character which cannot  be accessed by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, keys with null values will be removed.  No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: UpdateCharacterReadOnlyData
calls.summary: Updates the title-specific custom data for the user's character which can only be read by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.
